channel.title: CVE Feed for Apache -- Apache Tika
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Apache -- Apache Tika

item.title: CVE-2019-10093|2024-08-04T22:10:09.762Z -- apache -- apache%20tika
item.description: In Apache Tika 1.19 to 1.21, a carefully crafted 2003ml or 2006ml file could consume all available SAXParsers in the pool and lead to very long hangs. Apache Tika users should upgrade to 1.22 or later.

item.title: CVE-2019-10094|2024-08-04T22:10:09.434Z -- apache -- apache%20tika
item.description: A carefully crafted package/compressed file that, when unzipped/uncompressed yields the same file (a quine), causes a StackOverflowError in Apache Tika's RecursiveParserWrapper in versions 1.7-1.21. Apache Tika users should upgrade to 1.22 or later.

item.title: CVE-2020-1950|2024-08-04T06:54:00.402Z -- apache -- apache%20tika
item.description: A carefully crafted or corrupt PSD file can cause excessive memory usage in Apache Tika's PSDParser in versions 1.0-1.23.

item.title: CVE-2019-10088|2024-08-04T22:10:09.443Z -- apache -- apache%20tika
item.description: A carefully crafted or corrupt zip file can cause an OOM in Apache Tika's RecursiveParserWrapper in versions 1.7-1.21. Users should upgrade to 1.22 or later.
